tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: There is no greater expert than him who understands the pains and sufferings of the patients and gives them appropriate treatment. He is the true God.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Dr. Kanniraj is excellent to approach with patients. Well convincing has a healing touch, and does prescribe medicine what is really essential. Just started his advice n prescription for shoulder pain, will let you know in details over the course of healing. The physiotherapist feedback to excercise was also commendable.
Although appointment was taken in the morning for evening visit waiting time due to first come first serve basis is there, but no regrets on it.
Could make the receptionists let the patient know when our turn is in advance but pardonable. A digital display could make a difference for this purpose. Pharmacy seems nominal. Overall ambience is calm and worthy. Hope this kind of treatment sustains and never change in due course of time.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We have tried many doctors for wife's toe problem but
1. None of the doctor give the reason for the problem
2. None of the doctor has even touched the leg and understand the problem.
3. All the doctors first ask to take X ray and give pain killer tablets and ask to do physiotherapy for 10 days but the problems still persist

After visiting Dr.Kanniraj we feel some positive approach as he described the problem clearly and he didn't ask us to take X ray and did ask us to go for physiotherapy...he has asked us to do simple excercise after understanding the problem and we think it would cure her pain. Thanks to him.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Wait time,Treatment satisfaction,
context: Pain Management for Chronic Back Pain,Orthopedic Consultation,Fracture Treatment,Total Hip Replacement,
review:
Posted this because to help others & when someone really need it.

Even though my father met with severe fracture on last July 2017, he made him walk very well at an very affordable cost which I never imagined.

There are certain things which we can only feel it.

Nobody can understand even if I describe it.

When my father admitted into a popular ortho hospital in chennai, They told me that cost of hip replacement would be around 7 lakhs.

By god grace, i got connected to this doctor through our regular doctor.

Cost me a total of 1.4 lakhs ( Inc of Hospital charges for 5 days, Room rent etc & got covered by my brother insurance.)

Now my father started walking very well.

We will get confident about our health when he speaks...

He saved me from making huge debts.

Our family will never forget him.

After an year I went there for severe back pain.

After checking, he prescribed some exercises to learn it from physio therapist.

Definitely I will be better by doing it twice a day.

Scans, tablet, Injection won't be prescribed unless it requires.

I promise that you will definitely forget about all your worries, pains if you reach over there.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: Doc was very friendly and welcoming… clearly explained the cause of neck pain by carefully examining me.Best part is that no medicines was prescribed to me.(hehe)He mentioned that physiotherapy would easily ease of the neck pain gradually.😃😃After 1st day of physio I could feel some improvement in my neck. Overall, it was a warm and pleasant experience.

Explained me detail about my infection and mobilization of my knee bending and taught me few phyiso-Exercise to be done in home . Personally I feel , doctor is cool , energetic ,  highly skilled  to treat in my case . Looking forward for my next visit with my ESR and CRP report

review:
Made a systematic approach towards diagnosis. First of all touched and did a detailed diagnosis which is very rare these days (I'm not referring pandemic here). He listened with patience when we explained the pain and as well explained about the history of the injury.

Advised medication, and suggested that if the pain reduces no need of further investigation. Didn't advise unnecessary imaging.

Most importantly consoled and gave confidence.

I Would highly recommend to anyone who needs a good Ortho consultation.
